page.title: 19CRAIGHOUSE
page.content: Craighouse has, according to records, been in existance since the reign of King David II. There is some evidence that the house and grounds were owned by the Abbey of Newbattle as far back as 1528. Craighouse changed hands many times during the 17th and 18th centuries, one of the owners being Sir William Dick of Braid, one of the wealthiest men in Edinburgh at that time. In 1746, the first of many extensions was built. Craighouse and its surrounding land were sold to the commissioners of the Edinburgh Lunatic Asylum in 1878, after which a series of new buildings were added,and it still functions as a hospital today. There is an underground passage leading from the basement which some people believe eventually emerges at Edinburgh Castle.
